metadata.title: How to Use YouTube Audio Library 2025: Free Music and Sounds
metadata.description: Use YouTube's free Audio Library. Find royalty-free music and sound effects.

hero.headline: How to Use YouTube Audio Library
hero.subheadline: Free music and sounds. No copyright claims on your videos.

sections.content: YouTube's Audio Library offers thousands of free songs and sound effects—legitimately free, no copyright claims, no attribution required for most tracks. It's underrated because creators don't know about it or how to use it effectively. Here's how to find the perfect audio for your videos.

sections.title: Accessing Audio Library
content: Use filters: Genre, Mood, Duration, etc.

sections.title: Audio Library Tips
content: Star good tracks for future use
Sound effects free and high quality
No claims ever on these tracks

faq.question: Will I get copyright claims using Audio Library?
faq.answer: No—tracks are specifically cleared for YouTube use. That's the whole point. Some tracks require attribution in description, but no monetization claims. Completely safe to use.

faq.question: Is the music good quality?
faq.answer: Quality varies—some excellent, some basic. More tracks added regularly. For premium quality, paid services (Epidemic Sound, Artlist) offer more selection. But Audio Library is solid for free.

faq.question: Can I use on other platforms?
faq.answer: Check each track's license. YouTube Audio Library is designed for YouTube, but many tracks are usable elsewhere. Some may have platform restrictions. When in doubt, use only on YouTube.

faq.question: How often is new music added?
faq.answer: Regularly—YouTube continuously adds tracks. Check back periodically for fresh options. Star favorites so you don't lose them. Build a personal library of go-to tracks.
